title: Essays critical and imaginative,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: What three beautiful flights might our Fancy take, following the Three Eivers to their friths and seas ! What would hinder her from breakfasting with the benevolent Owen, and studying the new philosophy in his cotton-mills ? Why might she not write a criticism on the pictures in Hamilton Palace, and embody in it a history of the art from Apelles to Haydon. " Oh ! Bothwell Bank, thou bloomest fair ! and Mary Queen ! what woes were thine from the day thy virgin zone was untied by the youthful Francis, till thy lovely neck was bared to the headsman's axe ! Then, what punchbowls in Glasgow — what " herrings at the Broomie- law ! " And hath to Dumbarton Castle the sword of Wallace
